products.title: Burera
products.body_html:
The Burera district in Rwanda is known for its rich volcanic soils that support abundant fruit and vegetable farming. Historically, coffee has not been grown here, but a new project is underway to change that. Farmers are planting coffee trees all across the district, creating an important source of income diversification. The early results are impressive, with excellent quality emerging from the region. This is our first year purchasing coffee from Burera and we’re delighted to find bright and juicy flavors of black currant and mango in our cups. 
 
Pronunciation: boo-RARE-ra

Images courtesy of M.O Studios and Ikawa House

products.title: Yonal Fernandez
products.body_html:
The coffees we source from the Colasay region have quickly become some of our favorites in all of Peru. Yonal Fernandez is part of a small group of producers in Colasay whose coffee we began purchasing in late 2019. His coffee has been featured in  Fast Forward and La Viuda, but this is the first time we’re showcasing it as a unique microlot. 
Together with his wife, Imelda, Yonal cultivates the unique Bourbon de Colasay variety–a regional mutation that performs equally well in the field and in the cup. We’ve had the opportunity to spend time with Yonal during our visits over the years, sharing meals and learning about what makes this region so special. Colasay’s combination of rugged terrain, unique varieties, and highly skilled producers are a recipe for exceptional quality. We’re excited to highlight Yonal’s work with this small lot, available only to our single origin subscribers. Look for sweet and balanced notes of raisin, chocolate, and brown sugar that epitomize the excellence emerging from Colasay.

Pronunciation: yo-NAL fer-NAN-dez

products.title: La Palestina
products.body_html:
La Palestina began as a small plot planted by Don Juan Alarcón in 1978. As his family grew, so did the size of the farm as he purchased additional land to pass on to his children. Over time, the Alarcóns have worked to create a farm that seamlessly weaves together tradition and innovation. Since our first visit to Palestina in 2018, we’ve seen a range of investments that have not only improved coffee quality but also increased biodiversity. This exclusive lot comes to us from the plot of Juan’s son, Jose Praxedes Alarcón. It’s a single variety called Marshell–a local mutation related to Catimors but with a cup quality that sets it apart. We taste fruited notes of plum and citrus alongside a cola-like sweetness.

Pronunciation: la pal-ess-TEEN-uh

products.title: Intango
products.body_html:
The Intango coffee washing station is owned by Gilbert Gatali, a widely recognized leader in Rwanda’s relatively young and thriving specialty coffee sector. Gilbert believes in coffee's potential to transform lives, and his passion for coffee and the people behind it is inspiring to witness. We taste notes of apricot, citrus, and black tea—a classic Rwanda profile that keeps us coming back year after year.

Pronunciation: in-TAHN-go

products.title: Corduroy Hat + Atmos Canister Bundle
products.body_html:
This duo is a great gift for the coffee lover in your life! Treat them to a holiday season filled with both fashion and fresh brews. Originally valued at $72, save $10 when you shop the bundle!

Corduroy Hat:
Show your love for coffee with our exclusive black, corduroy hat. The 100% cotton, six-panel, flat-peak cap with an adjustable fastener is the perfect statement piece for coffee die-hards. Whether you're headed to your favorite coffee shop, running errands, or simply enjoying a day out, this hat lets everyone know where your heart truly lies—with coffee.

Fellow Atmos Canister:
Preserve the flavor and freshness of your favorite coffee beans. The 1.2 L airtight, matte black canister is the perfect addition to your kitchen counter. These containers also list the canister weight, making it easy to refill your coffee beans in bulk. Elevate your coffee storage and make every cup even more delicious.

products.title: Fundochamba
products.body_html:
Fundochamba is a small mountain community just outside of Quilanga in Ecuador’s Loja province. Local farmers have partnered with Roberto Jimenez of Capamaco Trading, whose expertise has connected them to the specialty market. This season presented some unique challenges as wildfires spread across the mountains near Quilanga at the tail end of the harvest. Undeterred, Roberto navigated the fires with his truck to collect coffee from each grower, ensuring their harvest wasn’t lost. Fortunately, no one was injured, farm damage was minimal, and the coffee emerged unscathed. We love this coffee for its dried apricot-like fruit tones layered over a cozy chocolate and toasted almond base.

 
Pronunciation: Foon-Doe-Cham-bAH

products.title: Fast Forward
products.body_html: Enjoying fresh, delicious coffee should be a year-round affair. That's why Fast Forward is a curated blend of similar coffees from different harvest periods, ensuring you can savor the freshest flavors no matter the season. The ever-changing selection of organic coffees guarantees a delightful balance of nutty and sweet notes, wrapped in a creamy body that will leave you craving another cup.

products.title: Finca La Hermosa Gesha – Dual Process
products.body_html:
Born and raised among coffee plantations, Max Pérez was acutely aware of both the risks and potential within the coffee industry. Driven by a desire to “make the coffee dreams come true,” he and his wife, Claudia, founded Finca La Hermosa in 2010. Situated on the slopes of the Acatenango volcano, the coffee farm benefits from fertile volcanic soils that nurture a diverse range of coffee varieties, including an entire “Gesha forest.” This coffee combines two distinct processing techniques - honey and natural sundried. The honey process incorporates anaerobic fermentation while leaving the sticky mucilage on the coffee seed for 2 days before being dried. Through the natural process, coffee cherries are dried with their fruit intact for 30 days on raised beds. Roasting these two coffees together results in the distinguished characteristics of blueberry, honeysuckle and limeade, a beautiful reflection of both processes and variety.

Pronunciation: FEENG-kah lah ehr-moh-sah

products.title: Gesha Variety Trio - SOLD OUT
products.body_html:
This three-pack invites you to explore the celebrated Gesha variety through the art of processing. First collected from Ethiopian forests in the 1930s, Gesha seedlings were soon distributed to research stations around the world for classification and breeding. It gained iconic status in 2004 when a uniquely floral selection set record auction prices at the Best of Panama competition. This marked the variety’s entrance into the specialty coffee pantheon and sparked a surge of cultivation across Central and South America.

As Gesha gained recognition for its remarkable quality, producers began experimenting with different processing methods to further enhance its unique flavor profile. Processing, or removing coffee beans from their cherries and drying them, plays a pivotal role in shaping a coffee’s flavor profile. For a distinctive variety like Gesha, processing can unlock complex, nuanced qualities. This trio highlights the choices made by expert producers to showcase Gesha’s exceptional pedigree, resulting in unforgettable cups of special coffee.

products.title: El Batan
products.body_html:
El Batan is a small coffee-farming community nestled in the highlands of Loja, Ecuador. This year, four farms from the area approached Roberto Jiménez, our export partner in Ecuador, seeking his help to connect with a buyer for their coffee. When Roberto shared a sample with us, we were immediately impressed by the quality and knew it would be a perfect fit for our Single Origin Subscription program. Each grower carefully harvested and pulped uniformly ripe red coffee cherries, then fermented the coffee for 48 hours––about a day longer than is typical––to enhance fruit flavors in the cup. Look for jammy plum and blackberry flavors rooted in a deep chocolatey sweetness.

Pronunciation: El ba-TAHN

products.title: Counter Culture Coffee Digital Gift Card
products.body_html:
Searching for the perfect gift to thrill the coffee connoisseur in your life? A Counter Culture Gift Digital Card is the ultimate way to deliver the joy of freshly roasted coffee while giving them the freedom to choose their favorites. With the option to include a personalized message and schedule the delivery for the perfect moment, it's more than a gift—it's an invitation to elevate their coffee experience!

Only redeemable at counterculturecoffee.com!

products.title: Dambi Udo – Natural Sundried
products.body_html: Before coffee became a global commodity, it was produced like Dambi Udo Natural Sundried: cultivated in Ethiopia's forests under a dense canopy of shade, harvested by hand, and dried as whole cherries. At the Guji Highland estate in Dambi Udo village, they preserve this tradition while using modern techniques to harness the complex flavors of coffee's origin. Sun drying on raised beds imparts vibrant, saturated fruit flavors in the cup reminiscent of ripe blueberries, dried dates, and cocoa.

products.title: Best in Snow Bundle
products.body_html:
Our Best in Snow bundle brings together two of our most beloved and best-selling coffees. Year after year, Big Trouble and La Golondrina take the top spots for our best-selling year-round blend and best-selling single-origin coffees. Try the classic rich and nutty profiles of Big Trouble and La Golondrina and see why they are favorites among coffee enthusiasts.

  • Best-Sellers: Big Trouble and La Golondrina are best-selling coffees in their categories, celebrated for their exceptional flavors.
  • Nutty Notes: Both blends feature delightful nutty undertones, creating a cohesive tasting experience.
  • Versatile Brewing: Whether enjoyed as an espresso, pour-over, or drip, these coffees cater to every brewing preference.
  • Bundle and save: Save 40% and explore these fan favorites.

products.title: Haand x Counter Culture Diner Mug
products.body_html:
This limited-edition mug is a heartfelt tribute to the classic diner style, designed for those who appreciate a truly great coffee experience. We collaborated with our friends at Haand to create this handmade ceramic piece, capturing the essence of comfort and nostalgia. Inspired by cherished memories of road trips and late-night diners, it features an ergonomic handle and a thoughtfully balanced shape. It holds 10 oz of your favorite brew while keeping it hot. Enjoy it as you share moments with friends or savor a quiet cup on your own.

  • Holds: 10 oz comfortably
  • Available in a limited edition glaze called Buttermilk Pink
  • Handmade in Burlington, NC
  • Microwave and dishwasher safe
  • Stamped with a co-branded Haand x Counter Culture logo

products.title: Fellow Tumbler 3-in-1 Set – 16 oz
products.body_html:
Discover the Fellow Tumbler 3-in-1 set—a limited-edition collection designed for unforgettable coffee moments. This versatile set includes the award-winning Carter Move Mug, featuring a stylish smoke green finish and the words “Coffee Driven” elegantly displayed on its ceramic surface. With three unique lid variations, it’s all beautifully packaged for gifting. Each tumbler embodies uncompromised quality and style, perfect for savoring your favorite coffee. Whether you’re sharing a warm drink with loved ones or enjoying a quiet morning ritual, this stunning set elevates every sip and enhances your coffee experience throughout the season.

  • Size: 16 oz Mug
  • Color: Smoke Green
  • Materials: Ceramic coating, Move Lid + Splash Guard, Cold Lid + Straw, Carry Lid
  • Cleaning: Hand wash only

products.title: Coffee Driven Hoodie – Vintage Black
products.body_html:
Step up your hoodie game this season with our Coffee Driven unisex mineral-washed hoodie, designed for ultimate comfort and a timeless look. Crafted from 100% combed ringspun cotton, this hoodie feels just like your favorite worn-in sweatshirt, offering substantial softness and a cozy fit. Featuring raglan sleeves, it’s perfect for layering on chilly days or lounging at home. Whether you’re grabbing coffee with friends or enjoying a quiet moment, this hoodie is your go-to for relaxed, stylish comfort.

  • Sizes S - XXXL
  • Lightweight - 8.25 oz
  • 100% cotton
  • Unisex sizing, regular fit, crew neck / size up for loose fit
  • Color: Vintage Black, garment may have dying irregularities
  • Care: Machine wash cold, tumble dry low
  • Shirts made by lane seven and screen printed by Durham-based Inkfinity Printing

products.title: Coffee Driven Crew Socks
products.body_html:
Who can resist a cozy pair of socks? Celebrate your love for Counter Culture with these fun, premium-quality crew socks! Crafted from a soft 75% cotton blend, these unisex socks fit most, making them the perfect gift for your favorite coffee enthusiast. Featuring woven designs that highlight your coffee obsession, they’re ideal for stocking stuffers, swag at work, or just treating yourself. A delightful surprise for the coffee lover in your life!

  • Color: Orange
  • One size fits most
  • Description: Knit. 12" L x 3" W
  • Made in the USA

products.title: Black Trucker Hat
products.body_html:
Show your love for Counter Culture with our black 5-panel trucker hat, featuring our iconic Counter Culture Coffee logo on the front. Made from a comfortable blend of foam and nylon, this hat includes rear mesh panels for breathability and an integrated cotton sweatband for added comfort.

With a pre-curved bill and adjustable plastic snap closure, it offers a perfect fit for most. Whether you’re at a coffee shop or out and about, this hat lets everyone know where your passion lies!

  • Color: Black
  • Mid-Profile 5-Panel trucker hat with foam front panels and rear mesh panels
  • Fabric: 55% Foam, 45% Nylon
  • Integrated cotton sweatband
  • One size fits most: adjustable plastic snap closure
  • Black with white logo screen printed on the front
  • Made by DECKY and customized by Inkfinity Printing

products.title: Kanelite Estate
products.body_html: Kanelite Estate is run by the wife and husband team Irene Njagi and Nelson Muchiri. This second generation farm is located in Embu near Mt. Kenya's eastern slopes, in some of the best coffee growing conditions in the country. Focused on quality processing and community building, the estate measures success both in cup quality and the well-being of the people who work there. This year's harvest is sweet and savory, with notes of black currant, tamarind and sungold tomato.

products.title: Twelve Days of Coffee - SOLD OUT
products.body_html:
Unwrap the magic of the season! We've curated 12 delicious coffees for the ultimate tasting adventure. As the days grow colder and the holidays draw near, there's no better way to celebrate the season than with a cup of exceptional coffee.

  • Roasts and ships November 25–27*
  • Only 150 boxes available
  • 12 carefully curated 4 oz bags of coffee
  • Packaged and shipped in a beautifully designed box, perfect for gifting
  • Includes: Booklet with information about each coffee and a scratch-off card for a little something extra each day
  • Share the joy of coffee with your loved ones, or keep it all to yourself for a daily dose of happiness

Explore the set more here: Twelve Days of Coffee

*Any items purchased in addition to the Twelve Days of Coffee will ship the same day as the set.

products.title: Kamwea Estate
products.body_html: For Nyaga Kamwea, the Kamwea Estate is both a tribute to his late father and a legacy he hopes to pass on to his son. Located in Kenya's eastern province, an area known more for corn than coffee, the Kamwea estate defies this reputation by producing some of the highest-quality coffee in the area. This year’s harvest boasts bright citrus balanced by currant and nectarine fruit tones.

products.title: Muriama Estate
products.body_html:
Muriama estate, a reimagined second-generation coffee farm in Kenya, reflects the family’s commitment to progress. Founded in 1954 by Simon Ngariama with just 100 trees, the farm spent decades selling coffee cherries to the local cooperative. Since taking over, Simon’s son, Njogu, and his wife Esther have expanded the estate by planting more trees, investing in post-harvest processing equipment, and incorporating it as a private estate named Muriama, a blend of their surnames. The shift to processing their own coffee has allowed them to retain more value and market directly to international buyers, resulting in enhanced quality and transparency. This season's harvest has blood orange-like acidity that is balanced by jammy black currant and hibiscus tones. 

Pronunciation: MOO-ree-ah-ma

products.title: Gigantic
products.body_html: Coffee beans come in all shapes and sizes. Gigantic is a blend of Pacamara—a variety of the Arabica coffee plant that produces exceptionally large beans. The combination results in a complex coffee with big big notes of fuji apple, nectarine, and caramel.

products.title: CaféNor Pacamara
products.body_html: Pacamara, a remarkable coffee variety from El Salvador, is the result of crossbreeding the local Pacas variety with Maragogipe, a variety known for its large bean size and outsized, punchy flavor. This unique hybrid is a hallmark of Salvadorian specialty coffee, and our partners at Cafenor have curated a stunning example of the variety's full potential. This coffee is a blend of both washed and honey-processed coffee and is brimming with vibrant fruit flavors. Look for notes of juicy stone fruit and red grapes rooted in deep chocolatey sweetness.

products.title: Bulk Coffee
products.body_html: Elevate your holiday season with our convenient bulk coffee bags crafted for true coffee enthusiasts. Each bag provides up to 100 cups of our signature, year-round blends, so you're always prepared to brew your favorite flavors. Enjoy rich, satisfying taste while saving money—and sip your way through the festivities.

products.title: Duromina
products.body_html:
The Duromina Cooperative emerged from a Technoserve project that transformed coffee production in Arago, Ethiopia. Prior to the project, coffee in this area was considered low quality and sold for low prices. Training in quality practices and cooperative business administration coupled with strategic infrastructure investments resulted in high-quality coffee and enduring economic opportunities for farmers. Duromina’s success is largely due to their beautifully expressive coffee: sweet, tea-like, and perfumed with honeysuckle-like florals and stone fruit flavors.

Pronunciation: Dur-Ooo ME-na

products.title: Polar Espresso Bundle
products.body_html:
Elevate your espresso with our two fan-favorite coffees for espresso. With low acidity and a medium-dark roast level, Big Trouble’s caramel, nutty, and round notes make it perfect for espresso. Forty-Six offers a more classic and traditional espresso experience - it’s dark, rich, and flavorful. Both roasted to perfection, these coffees shine as espresso and pair perfectly with milk for lattes or cappuccinos.

  • Perfect espresso harmony: Both Big Trouble and Forty-Six deliver flavors ideal for espresso. Enjoy these coffees with milk for lattes or cappuccinos, unlocking a new dimension of flavor.
  • Espresso and more: While both of these coffees shine brewed as espresso, you can use any brewing method you want! Try them as a pour-over or French press and experience their range.
  • Bundle and save: Save 20% and explore these go-to espresso coffee blends.

products.title: Winter Solstice Bundle
products.body_html:
Featuring our two darkest roasted coffees, Gradient and Forty-Six, this set is perfect for those who appreciate the bold and indulgent notes of dark roasts. Even with a darker roast, these high-quality coffees maintain complex, delicious, and unique. Don’t miss out on trying the darkest and richest roasts in the Counter Culture Coffee line-up.

  • Dark and delicious: Gradient and Forty-Six offer a rich and indulgent experience, perfect for dark roast enthusiasts.
  • Versatile Brewing: Whether enjoyed as an espresso or pour-over these coffees cater to every brewing preference.
  • Bundle and save: Save 20% and explore the darkest Counter Culture Coffee blends.

products.title: Pompilio Garcia Luna
products.body_html:
Just outside the remote community of San Vicente Yogondoy, Pompilio Garcia Luna tends to a plot of the traditional coffee variety known as Pluma Hidalgo. This adaptation of the Typica varieties that were amongst the first coffee trees brought to the Americas thrives on the steep slopes and in the lush shade canopy of the rugged Sierra Sur mountain range. Pairing this variety with Pompilio’s meticulous cherry selection and processing results in a prime example of a top quality Oaxacan coffee. We taste notes of dark chocolate and dried fruit tied together with a honey-like sweetness.

Pronunciation: pom-PEEL-ee-o gar-SEE-ah LOO-nuh

products.title: Jabanto – Natural Sundried
products.body_html:
Counter Culture’s relationship with the Jabanto farmers group is the epitome of transparent and traceable sourcing in Ethiopia. Its members have worked hard to build an enterprising business from scratch, and their commitment to careful harvesting and processing each year results in some of our favorite offerings. Jabanto showcases a range of flavors that have made naturally processed coffee from Yirgacheffe so famous. We taste flavors of blueberry and chocolate accented with sweet notes of honey.

Pronunciation: juh-BAHN-toe
